title: Antisymmetric Tensor Fields in the Locally Localized Gravity Models
abstract: We study the localization property of antisymmetric tensor fields in the locally localized gravity models. It is shown that all the antisymmetric tensor fields, including the vector field, in a bulk space-time are trapped on an $AdS$ brane by a gravitational interaction where the presence of the brane cosmological constant plays an important role as in the cases of the other bulk fields. The normalized zero-modes spread rather widely in extra space so small extra dimensions might be needed in order not to conflict with experiment.
